title: Enperry
content:
Enperry is a gear brand in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. Enperry gear has 5× chance more likely to roll Sub Power Up as a secondary ability, with a 0.5× chance to roll Ink Resistance Up.

Enperry specializes in sportswear gear such as tank tops, jerseys, and basketball shoes, many of them sharing the "King" label. Some of their gear features a crown similar to the one worn by Pearl.

Enperry's logo features a realistic-styled squid, possibly based on the giant squid (though its visible eye more closely resembles that of an octopus), above the brand's name in Inkling text.

For the category page, see Category:Enperry.

- Enperry Splat Dualies (collaboration with "Splat")

Enperry has gear with the labels 'Eminence', 'Enperrial', 'King', 'Octoking', 'N-Pacer' and 'Squidkid'.

Reaching a cumulative amount of stars on Enperry gear will reward the player with badges.

There were not enough gear items available before version 7.0.0 to gain the 100+ stars badge.

- Blue logo

- Alternative green logo used for the King label

- Enperry promo art of an Inkling wearing the King Flip Mesh and the White King Tank

- Information from The Art of Splatoon 2

- A promotional image from The Art of Splatoon 2

- The back of Crusty Sean's hat has Enperry's name on it

- A jellyfish wearing an unnamed Enperry shirt

- An Inkling from Splatoon 3 media wearing the Retro Framers

- A magazine of Enperry gear from Splatoon 3

- Clean version with logo seen on SplatNet 3 Enperry daily drops

- Promotional image for Splatoon 3

- Enperry's name in Inkling loosely resembles 大王イカ (daiō-ika), the Japanese name for the giant squid.

- In Splatoon 2, Crusty Sean wears a white baseball cap turned backwards with Enperry's name on it. This hat does not resemble any Enperry headgear available to players.

- In Splatoon 2, prior to version 3.1.0, an advertisement for this brand is one of the rotating ads on the left side jumbotron in Inkopolis Square. The advertisement is seen on the jumbotron in Starfish Mainstage in the later versions, however.

- There is no Enperry gear that has Comeback, Last-Ditch Effort, Ninja Squid, or Special Power Up as a primary ability.

- Team Emperor from the manga is known for only wearing Enperry gear.

- Alongside Grizzco, both brands have at least one piece of gear that was previously from an another brand. In Enperry's case, FC Albacore was previously from Takoroka until it was changed to Enperry in Splatoon 3.

- Enperry is one of the Grand Festival sponsors.[5]
